version.name: Tron: Legacy
version.review: Director: Joseph Kosinski 2010. Jeff Bridges, Garrett Hedlund, Olivia Wilde, Bruce Boxleitner, James Frain, Beau Garrett and Michael Sheen. Tron: Legacy has been talked about for its music as much as the film. The music that Daft Punk recorded for this film has been leaking to the Internet for months. Daft Punk recorded the soundtrack with a 85-person orchestra. The film is just as magnificent as the soundtrack. Tron: Legacy was based in a digital world that looks like nothing we've seen on the silver screen before. It's an advanced technology 3D adventure that takes as its subject Sam Flynn (Garrett Hedlund), who's the 27-year-old technology geek son of Kevin Flynn (Jeff Bridges). Sam Flynn is researching his father's disappearance and finds himself in the digital world of Tron, where his father has been living for 25 years. Together with Kevin's loyal friend Quorra (Olivia Wilde), father and son go on a quest of life and death in an visually mind-blowing cyber world that has become extremely dangerous. In theatres January 28. Seda Pekçelen

version.name: Burlesque
version.review: Director: Steve Antin 2010. Kristen Bell, Cam Gigandet, Christina Aguilera, Eric Dane, Alan Cumming, Stanley Tucci, Peter Gallagher. Burlesque is a musical film that is receiving a lot of attention with its cast, featuring Christina Aguilera and Cher. Ali Rose (Christina Aguilera) is a character who leaves her past and her small town behind to live in Los Angeles. Ali has a strong voice, and upon arriving in Los Angeles, she begins to work as a waitress at Burlesque Lounge, one of the city's most important clubs. Yet her dream is to be on the stage. The club is faced with some financial and personal problems right around this time. As a result, Tess (Cher), who operates the club, tries to find a solution. Ali takes the stage, mesmerising audiences with her voice. As always, this leads to a lot of jealousy and competition. In theatres January 21. Seda Pekçelen

version.name: The Tree
version.review: Director: Julie Bertucelli 2010. Charlotte Gainsbourg, Morgana Davies, Marton Csokas. The Tree is the latest project by young director Julie Bertucelli, whose movie Since Otar Left earned her wide acclaim. The Tree premiered at the Sydney Film Festival in 2010, and it was also shown as the closing movie at Cannes Film Festival. Dawn (Charlotte Gainsbourg) is a woman who's left alone with her kids after losing her husband. When Dawn tells her little daughter Simone (Morgana Davies) that her father's spirit lives in the tree in their garden, she accepts this as a childish joke. This fantastical event, which no one believes at first, begins to receive acceptance among the family. After some time, the kids start speaking with their father, whom they believe lives in the tree, and Dawn follows their lead. In theatres January 21. Seda Pekçelen

version.name: 127 Hours
version.review: Director: Danny Boyle 2010. James Franco, Lizzy Caplan, Kate Mara, Amber Tamblyn. 127 Hours is the latest project by Danny Boyle, who won an Oscar with Slumdog Millionaire and became engrained in people's memory with the cult film Trainspotting. Golden Globe winner James Franco plays the lead role as mountain climber Aron Ralston. Others who contributed in the film include Simon Beaufoy and Christian Colson, whom Danny Boyle also worked with in Slumdog Millionaire. Let's also mention that 127 Hours is nominated for the Golden Globe in the "Best Male Actor" (James Franco), "Best Scenario" (Danny Boyle, Simon Beaufoy) and "Best Music" (A. R. Rahman) categories. In theatres January 28. Seda Pekçelen

version.name: Biutiful
version.review: Director: Alejandro González Iñárritu 2010. Javier Bardem, Blanca Portillo, Martina Garcia, Felix Cubero. Biutiful is the latest film by director Iñárritu, whose films Amores Perros, 21 Grams and Babel you may have seen. Both the scenario and the directing belong to Iñárritu. There is also Javier Bardem, who plays a character named Uxbal in the film. Biutiful takes place in Barcelona, where Uxbal is a man who's involved in illegal activities and on the run from the police. Yet Uxbal is also a loyal father who leads a life of crime in order to get money to take care of his family. Let's also remind you that Biutiful competed for the Golden Palm in this year's Cannes Festival. In theatres January 28

version.name: Love and Other Drugs
version.review: Director: Edward Zwick 2010. Jake Gyllenhaal, Anne Hathaway, Josh Gad, Judy Greer, Gabriel Macht. Love and Other Drugs is the latest film by Edward Zwick, the director of The Last Samurai. Anne Hathaway plays Maggie Murdock, while Jake Gyllenhaal plays Jamie Randall. Maggie is a free-spirited young woman who's afraid of commitment, while Jamie is an irresistibly attractive man who works for the pharmaceutical industry and is not afraid to use his appeal in business, as well. Needless to say, no one believes that the result will be love when Maggie and Jamie first meet. Yet as the relationship progresses, the love they experience starts to influence them in good ways. Love and Other Drugs was nominated for the 'Best Male Actor' (Jake Gyllenhaal), 'Best Female Actor' (Anne Hathaway) and 'Best Music' (A. R. Rahman) categories in this year's Golden Globe Awards. In theatres Januray 14. Seda Pekçelen

version.name: Kites
version.review: Director: Anurag Basu 2010. Bárbara Mori, Hrithik Roshan, Steven Michael Quezada, Nicholas Brown. Kites is a Bollywood film that is the first of its kind to receive a good rating in the United States. In this romantic-action movie, Hrithik Roshan plays J., a heavily-wounded man who's been left to die in the heat and rigorous land of the Mexican desert. J. was once a carefree young man, yet when we meet him he's a wanted criminal. What keeps him alive is the hope of finding his lover, Natasha (Bárbara Mori). Natasha is engaged to someone else yet retains hope that she'll reunite with J. She's also a very beautiful woman who changes the lives of men with whom she's involved. In theatres January 14. Seda Pekçelen

version.name: Megamind
version.review: Director: Tom McGrath 2010. Will Ferrell, Brad Pitt, Tina Fey, Jonah Hill Megamind is this month's animation film, which takes as its subject Megamind, the most intelligent and evil superhero ever. He's also the least successful. He tries every possible way to take over Metro City for years. Each attempt ends in failure, thanks to the unbeatable superhero who wears a cape and is known as Metro Man. Yet Metro Man's invincibility comes to an end someday, when he is killed while battling against an evil plan Megamind clumsily put into action. After that, life has no meaning for Megamind, as there's no point to being an evil superhero with no superhero. So Megamind sets out to create another superhero, named Titan, who's much bigger, better and stronger than Metro Man. Yet it doesn't take long for Titan to start thinking that it's much more fun being a bad guy than a good guy. Titan wants to destroy Earth, not conquer it. Now it is Megamind's job to defeat the evil monster he's created. In theatres January 14. Seda Pekçelen
